cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi SE of Charleston South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving generally north-northwest, forecast to reach the North Carolina coast late Friday night-Saturday, then lift north through the Mid-Atlantic and pass near or just west of New York City before moving offshore toward the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Lookout / southern Outer Banks, North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Surf City NC to Duck NC; Chesapeake Bay north of Windmill Point to Smith Point; Tidal Potomac south of Colonial Beach; remainder Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds, Chesapeake Bay south of North Beach, Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island; Storm Surge Warning Duck NC to Chincoteague VA, Neuse & Pamlico Rivers, portions of Albemarle/Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coast from South Carolina through New Jersey and southern New England, including New York Bight
weather_observation.wind: Intermittent tropical-storm-force gusts possible (sustained 20-30 mph, gusts to 40 mph) late Saturday into Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible along New Jersey shore, NY Harbor and western Long Island Sound at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain from late Friday night through Sunday could cause urban and poor-drainage flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and minor coastal erosion expected along the Jersey Shore and southern Long Island
